title: How to Make Banana Pops

steps.headline: Cover a baking tray with waxed paper.
Melt the chocolate chips.
steps.description: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate chips for about 2 minutes in a microwave, stirring every 30 seconds with a spoon until smooth and fully melted.

steps.headline: Place the sprinkles and walnuts into two separate bowls.
Stick popsicle sticks in the bottoms of all the bananas.
Dip the bananas in the melted chocolate.
steps.description: Swirl the banana pops around to remove any excess chocolate.

steps.headline: Roll the banana pops in the sprinkles and walnuts and lay them on the tray.
Freeze the banana pops for about 5-10 minutes, until the chocolate hardens.
Enjoy!
Mash the banana using a potato masher in a large bowl.
Add the heavy cream, milk, and sugar and mix until well-combined.
Pour the banana mixture into ice pop molds, filling each case all the way to the top.
Cover the ice pop tray with foil tightly.
Stick wooden popsicle sticks into each case.
Freeze the banana pops for about 1-2 hours, until hard and frozen.
Enjoy!
Cover a baking tray with waxed paper.
Stick popsicle sticks onto the bottoms of each banana.
Pour the yogurt in a tall glass and place the cereal in a bowl.
Dip the bananas in the yogurt, gently tapping on it to remove excess yogurt.
Roll the bananas in the cereal until fully coated.
Place the bananas on the baking tray.
Freeze the banana pops for about 2-3 hours until the yogurt hardens.
Enjoy!
Cover a baking tray with waxed paper.
Melt the vanilla bark.
steps.description: Place the vanilla bark in a microwave-safe bowl and melt or about 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds with a spoon until smooth and fully melted.

steps.headline: Poke cake pop sticks through the bottoms of the bananas.
Separate the different colors of the rainbow sugar in different bowls.
Dip the bananas in the melted vanilla bark, swirling it around to remove any excess bark.
Roll each banana in a different color of the rainbow sugar until fully coated.
Place the bananas on the baking tray.
Freeze the banana pops for about 2-3 hours until the vanilla bark hardens.
Enjoy!

text: Basic Banana Pops Cover a baking tray with waxed paper.  Melt the chocolate chips. In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate chips for about 2 minutes in a microwave, stirring every 30 seconds with a spoon until smooth and fully melted. Place the sprinkles and walnuts into two separate bowls.  Stick popsicle sticks in the bottoms of all the bananas.  Dip the bananas in the melted chocolate. Swirl the banana pops around to remove any excess chocolate. Roll the banana pops in the sprinkles and walnuts and lay them on the tray.  Freeze the banana pops for about 5-10 minutes, until the chocolate hardens.  Enjoy!  Creamy Banana Pops Mash the banana using a potato masher in a large bowl.  Add the heavy cream, milk, and sugar and mix until well-combined.  Pour the banana mixture into ice pop molds, filling each case all the way to the top.  Cover the ice pop tray with foil tightly.  Stick wooden popsicle sticks into each case.  Freeze the banana pops for about 1-2 hours, until hard and frozen.  Enjoy!  Crunchy Banana Pops Cover a baking tray with waxed paper.  Stick popsicle sticks onto the bottoms of each banana.  Pour the yogurt in a tall glass and place the cereal in a bowl.  Dip the bananas in the yogurt, gently tapping on it to remove excess yogurt.  Roll the bananas in the cereal until fully coated.  Place the bananas on the baking tray.  Freeze the banana pops for about 2-3 hours until the yogurt hardens.  Enjoy!  Rainbow Banana Pops Cover a baking tray with waxed paper.  Melt the vanilla bark. Place the vanilla bark in a microwave-safe bowl and melt or about 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds with a spoon until smooth and fully melted. Poke cake pop sticks through the bottoms of the bananas.  Separate the different colors of the rainbow sugar in different bowls.  Dip the bananas in the melted vanilla bark, swirling it around to remove any excess bark.  Roll each banana in a different color of the rainbow sugar until fully coated.  Place the bananas on the baking tray.  Freeze the banana pops for about 2-3 hours until the vanilla bark hardens.  Enjoy!
